front.title: Encapsulation of Simple TWAMP (STAMP) for Pseudowires and LSPs in MPLS Networks

abstract.t: Pseudowires (PWs) and Label Switched Paths (LSPs) are used in MPLS networks for various services including carrying layer 2 and layer 3 data packets. This document describes the procedure for encapsulation of the Simple Two-Way Active Measurement Protocol (STAMP) defined in RFC 8762 and its optional extensions defined in RFC 8972 for PWs and LSPs in MPLS networks. The procedure uses Generic Associated Channel (G-ACh) to encapsulate the STAMP test packets with or without adding an IP/UDP header.
